enumoption.shortdesc: Specifies that the month and year should be displayed.
Specifies that three letter day descriptions should be present.
Prevents the user from switching months with the calendar.
Displays each week numbers of the current year, down the left side of the calendar
Starts the calendar week on Monday, instead of the default Sunday
The object has been destroyed and is processing any shutdown callbacks required.
The object is not contained within another object.
There are signals which are connected to this object.
The object has undergone its construction process and is ready to be used.
The argument value can be queried.
The argument requires construction before use.

The argument needs construction. This flag will be set only once during the construction process. This flag cannot be set at the same time as GTK_ARG_WRITABLE and is not required when GTK_ARG_CONSTRUCT is set.
This flag is only presently used by GtkContainer. It specifies an argument type that is specific to that class.
Bitwise OR of the flag's, allows masking with bitwise AND's.
The argument can both be queried and set.
